cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles ESE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move WNW across the Greater Antilles, then turn northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the upper Texas–south-west Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas or southwest Louisiana coast (near the TX-LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Gulf Coast as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Gulf Coast as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coastline from southeast Louisiana westward to the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force winds (30–40 kt) are possible at the port late Aug 25–26; stronger if Laura reaches hurricane strength.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft surge along the upper Texas coast and into Galveston Bay depending on exact track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10 inches of rain possible, producing flash and urban flooding in the Houston–Galveston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High waves and dangerous seas in the Ship Channel; possible siltation and debris impacting navigation.
